alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 6:08PM CDT until May 11 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL BUREAU AND NORTHEASTERN PUTNAM COUNTIES... At 608 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Flash flooding is occurring in Spring Valley, with water completely covering Route 6 at Spring Valley Curve. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Valley, Ladd, Dalzell, Seatonville, Spring Valley Airport and Ottville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 68 and 72. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
